channel.title: Client request
channel.description:
Can someone point me to a client for 508, 525 and perhaps 474? I also need a 525 and 474 server with which to test these. Newbiehacker seems to have taken his copy of 508 down and so I don't know where to get one.
Thanks.

item.title: Client request
item.dc:creator: @peterbjornx peterbjornx
item.description:
@peterbjornx wrote:

If you want to have a look at my very refactored but broken client (ClientScript Runtime is ruined), PM me

Read full topic

item.title: Client request
item.dc:creator: @moparisthebest Moparisthebest
item.description:
@moparisthebest wrote:

[quote=“ry60003333, post:15, topic:279598”][quote author=Moparisthebest link=topic=368978.msg2836571#msg2836571 date=1245706852]
I always do. I use linux only, and even the current client runs great on linux (and I assume mac) doesn’t it?
[/quote]
It works, but the problem I had was that it saves the cache in /tmp, which is cleared when I shutdown. The real RS client now stores it’s cache in the home directory, so it doesn’t have to re-download the entire thing each time.[/quote]

Yea, that is due to jagex’s crappy findCacheDir function in the old signlink class, it will be fixed in the new version.

Read full topic

item.title: Client request
item.dc:creator: @ry60003333 ry60003333
item.description:
@ry60003333 wrote:

Moparisthebest:

I always do. I use linux only, and even the current client runs great on linux (and I assume mac) doesn’t it?

It works, but the problem I had was that it saves the cache in /tmp, which is cleared when I shutdown. The real RS client now stores it’s cache in the home directory, so it doesn’t have to re-download the entire thing each time.

Read full topic

item.title: Client request
item.dc:creator: @moparisthebest Moparisthebest
item.description:
@moparisthebest wrote:

ry60003333:

One thing, can you write and compile the client for JDK 5? It would be nice if the new client(s) worked on Windows/Mac/Linux, and not just Windows.

I always do. I use linux only, and even the current client runs great on linux (and I assume mac) doesn’t it?

Read full topic

item.title: Client request
item.dc:creator: @ry60003333 ry60003333
item.description:
@ry60003333 wrote:

One thing, can you write and compile the client for JDK 5? It would be nice if the new client(s) worked on Windows/Mac/Linux, and not just Windows.

Read full topic

item.title: Client request
item.dc:creator: @mod_taharok Taharok
item.description:
@mod_taharok wrote:

[quote=“Moparisthebest, post:11, topic:279598”][quote author=Taharok link=topic=368978.msg2823807#msg2823807 date=1244825871]

The server shouldn’t really have to handle anything differently, as it is not sending the cache or anything to the client as the real runescape does. So making the HD client identify to the server as a regular client should work just fine for private servers, right?

http://pastebin.com/m6255506e

That is a piece taken from RS2HD, which supports both regular and HD 508 clients. In the past, the packet storing the credentials of the user had the id of 10, but it looks now as if that packet will only have the id of 10 if it is a non-HD connection.

I continued to look throughout RS2HD, and it seems there is also an HD notification packet with the id of 129. I don’t know if whether the client is HD makes a difference beyond that, but those are the 2 ways the client notifies the server of an HD connection.
[/quote]

How is that ‘hd’ variable used then? Can you upload the server so I can scan the usages?[/quote]

Sure thing: http://ragingcoders.nationvoice.com/rs2hd.tar.bz2

Read full topic

item.title: Client request
item.dc:creator: @moparisthebest Moparisthebest
item.description:
@moparisthebest wrote:

[quote=“Taharok, post:9, topic:279598”][quote author=Moparisthebest link=topic=368978.msg2823786#msg2823786 date=1244823183]
The server shouldn’t really have to handle anything differently, as it is not sending the cache or anything to the client as the real runescape does. So making the HD client identify to the server as a regular client should work just fine for private servers, right?
[/quote]

http://pastebin.com/m6255506e

That is a piece taken from RS2HD, which supports both regular and HD 508 clients. In the past, the packet storing the credentials of the user had the id of 10, but it looks now as if that packet will only have the id of 10 if it is a non-HD connection.

I continued to look throughout RS2HD, and it seems there is also an HD notification packet with the id of 129. I don’t know if whether the client is HD makes a difference beyond that, but those are the 2 ways the client notifies the server of an HD connection.[/quote]

How is that ‘hd’ variable used then? Can you upload the server so I can scan the usages?

Read full topic

item.title: Client request
item.dc:creator: @ry60003333 ry60003333
item.description:
@ry60003333 wrote:

Yes they should both be able to connect, but on another site Celkyborg said that Palidino modified the login code of the non-HD client he released. So, to get a duel HD/SD server, he released a “non-modified” Standard Detail client, and I copied the login code for my client from that.

I do not know if that is true, but either way its still easy to make a duel server. I’ve actually made a video of mine which supports SD and HD in both resizable and fixed modes:
http://www.google.org/rs/508/duel_server_web.mov

Read full topic

item.title: Client request
item.dc:creator: @mod_taharok Taharok
item.description:
@mod_taharok wrote:

Moparisthebest:

The server shouldn’t really have to handle anything differently, as it is not sending the cache or anything to the client as the real runescape does. So making the HD client identify to the server as a regular client should work just fine for private servers, right?

http://pastebin.com/m6255506e

That is a piece taken from RS2HD, which supports both regular and HD 508 clients. In the past, the packet storing the credentials of the user had the id of 10, but it looks now as if that packet will only have the id of 10 if it is a non-HD connection.

I continued to look throughout RS2HD, and it seems there is also an HD notification packet with the id of 129. I don’t know if whether the client is HD makes a difference beyond that, but those are the 2 ways the client notifies the server of an HD connection.

Read full topic

item.title: Client request
item.dc:creator: @moparisthebest Moparisthebest
item.description:
@moparisthebest wrote:

The server shouldn’t really have to handle anything differently, as it is not sending the cache or anything to the client as the real runescape does. So making the HD client identify to the server as a regular client should work just fine for private servers, right?

Read full topic

item.title: Client request
item.dc:creator: @mod_taharok Taharok
item.description:
@mod_taharok wrote:

[quote=“Moparisthebest, post:6, topic:279598”][quote author=ry60003333 link=topic=368978.msg2823327#msg2823327 date=1244780192]
I’ve made a 474 and 508 client that automatically download the cache. However, I’ve modified the 508 client’s login method to match that of the 508 HD client, to allow for a server that supports both. (This means it cannot be used to connect to many servers.) I can give you both if you’d like.

Also, I actually don’t have a fully decompiled 508 HD client. Are you planning on making an HD MoparScape, and if you are, do you mind sharing the HD source?
[/quote]

I would think the HD and regular client could both connect to the same server no problem, that is, after all, how jagex’s servers work isn’t it?

You said you made clients that automatically download the cache, do you do it like moparscape does? Or some different way?

I will make an HD moparscape, and I’ll share the source.[/quote]

If I recall correctly, the HD login involves the existence of some value 10 byte or something. It signifies an HD login and then the server can handle it appropriately.

Read full topic

item.title: Client request
item.dc:creator: @moparisthebest Moparisthebest
item.description:
@moparisthebest wrote:

[quote=“ry60003333, post:5, topic:279598”]I’ve made a 474 and 508 client that automatically download the cache. However, I’ve modified the 508 client’s login method to match that of the 508 HD client, to allow for a server that supports both. (This means it cannot be used to connect to many servers.) I can give you both if you’d like.

Also, I actually don’t have a fully decompiled 508 HD client. Are you planning on making an HD MoparScape, and if you are, do you mind sharing the HD source? :|[/quote]

I would think the HD and regular client could both connect to the same server no problem, that is, after all, how jagex’s servers work isn’t it?

You said you made clients that automatically download the cache, do you do it like moparscape does? Or some different way?

I will make an HD moparscape, and I’ll share the source.

Read full topic

item.title: Client request
item.dc:creator: @ry60003333 ry60003333
item.description:
@ry60003333 wrote:

I’ve made a 474 and 508 client that automatically download the cache. However, I’ve modified the 508 client’s login method to match that of the 508 HD client, to allow for a server that supports both. (This means it cannot be used to connect to many servers.) I can give you both if you’d like.

Also, I actually don’t have a fully decompiled 508 HD client. Are you planning on making an HD MoparScape, and if you are, do you mind sharing the HD source?

Read full topic

item.title: Client request
item.dc:creator: @moparisthebest Moparisthebest
item.description:
@moparisthebest wrote:

sanga282:

you thinking of writing your own? an update to the moparscape client after all this time, now you finished school you got more time

I’m writing a moparscape for every client the new serverstatus page supports.

m.dog311:

I don’t have blank deobs, but I have the ones that are edited enough to play on RSPS (all the shit Pali removed because he was to lazy to put it in the servers).

That will be fine for now I suppose, can you upload them for me?

edit:
I can also probably deob them myself, but I still would like a server that people actually use to test them with, so if someone can get me a 474 and/or 525 server that would be great. (I already have a 508 one)

Read full topic
